Text.Value: We will address the matter of a cure for this infection once we reach the Material Plane.
*Your head throbs and your skin tingles. Visions rush past: a dragon's wing, a silver sword - and a flash of your face seen through the gith man's eyes.*
*Your head throbs and your skin tingles. Visions rush past: a dragon's wing, a silver sword - and a flash of your face seen through the strange man's eyes.*
By Vlaakith's touch, what is this?
Tsk'va. You are no thrall - Vlaakith blesses me this day! Together we might survive.
Who am I? Your only chance of survival.
Another survivor. We may yet see an end to this torment.
Who are you?
We can do nothing until we escape - that must be our priority.
*The artefact. You and others were to seize it from the githyanki. She may prove to be a foe, but for now offers aid...*
*Your head throbs and your skin tingles. Visions rush past: a dragon's wing, a silver sword - and a flash of your face seen through the gith's eyes.*
*Your head throbs and your skin tingles. Visions rush past: a dragon's wing, a silver sword - and a flash of your face seen through the strange woman's eyes.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Mindmeld animation-- player clutches their head

Text.Value: We need to figure out where we are.
Tsk'va. The parasite has already taken hold. We must take to a cr√®che and be cleansed.
My head. What is this... ngh.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Laezel] Start this dialogue in the Mindmeld lvl1 position. <SimonG>
EditorData.NodeContext: Lae'zel is experiencing her first mindmeld. She is well-versed in illithid matters and realizes htis mindmeld is due to the parasites in your heads.

Text.Value: We need to get rid of them and seek out the helm.
Have you forgotten yourself? Unless we escape - unless we are cleansed - our bodies and minds will be tainted and twisted.
We carry mind flayer parasites. Unless we escape - unless we are cleansed - our bodies and minds will be tainted and twisted.
Within days, we will be ghaik. Mind flayers.
I know this place. We are in Avernus, first of the Nine Hells.
What made you think I was a thrall?
We're in Avernus. First of the Nine Hells.
But first, we must get to the helm.
It's where we gain control over the ship. We must travel the planes - leave Avernus, before these imps tear us apart.
What's at the helm?
Lae'zel - you still live! May the Queen's favour be yours.
Htak'a!
No - forget it. We must ready ourselves for battle. There are imps blocking our path.
As for that thing - it will remain tame as long as it believes we are thralls. It may be of use in the fight to come.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Shot of the intellect devourer follower

Text.Value: Then you'll understand why we must leave at once.
What do you suggest?
Let us see what a soldier of Cr√®che K'liir can do.
Steel yourself and follow me.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Players move into position for combat. Lae'zel and player in parallel.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [DG]: REUSE: IMP_Rig_CINE_1HS_IDLE_Still_Peace_01, use Look-At to animate imps turning towards player. Otherwise create turning animation.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Imps scavenging around corpses look up.

Text.Value: Where are we?
Yes, we risk turning into mind flayers. But purification will have to wait until we take control of the ship.
We are turning into mind flayers? There must be something we can do!

EditorData.NodeContext: Lae'zel hovers over with  with hostility, dagger raised, appearing to be trying to kill you.

Text.Value: Abomination. This is your end.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [DG]: REUSE: Landing animation HUM_F_Rig_DFLT_CINE_JumpflightRecover to merge into VO anim.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Lae'zel leaps down from an awning overhead, appearing in front of the playe with dagger in hand. It is an ambush.

Text.Value: So they put a parasite in your eye, too?
First, we exterminate the imps. Then we find the helm and take control of the ship.

Synopsis: Companion Lae'zel or (alt gith if Laezel is avatar) will approach the player after spotting the player as she spies on some imps. During the dialogue she has a mindmeld with the player but brushes it aside.
